intro: Elaeocarpus hedyosmus, commonly known as the white sand elaeocarpus, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elliptical leaves that are glossy on the upper surface. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
